foundation.mission: To solve the critical problem of information overload faced by K-12 educators through a voice-enabled, context-aware AI assistant that provides district-specific knowledge and intelligent instructional feedback.
foundation.vision: To become the indispensable AI-powered command center for educators, transforming how teachers access district information and receive instructional support, ultimately freeing up their time for meaningful student interaction.
foundation.corePhilosophy: Go deep, not wide - focusing on hyper-contextualization and voice interface as defensible differentiators that competitors cannot easily replicate
foundation.keyAchievement: Core MVP functionality implemented with voice interface, RAG pipeline, and dashboard - now in final polish phase

currentSprintContext.priority: Critical bug fixes and UI/UX polish for demo
keyIssues: Inconsistent button styles and broken links
completedPhases: Day 1: Foundation & Setup (Environment, Backend, Documentation, UI Scaffolding)
Day 2: Core Build & Iteration (Voice Interface, RAG Pipeline, Landing Page V1, Dashboard V1)

problemStatement.coreProblem: K-12 educators face perpetual information overload, navigating a constant deluge of district policies, curriculum guides, student handbooks, and professional development materials without a centralized, intelligent system to synthesize this information.
problemStatement.painPoint: Teachers waste valuable time searching through multiple documents and systems to find specific information, leading to burnout and fragmented workflows that detract from meaningful student interaction.
problemStatement.marketValidation: The AI in EdTech market is projected to grow from $2.21-5.88 billion (2024) to over $90 billion by 2033, driven by demand for personalized learning and administrative automation.

solution.overview: A.I.D.A. is an AI-powered instructional command center that augments human expertise rather than replacing it. The MVP delivers two core capabilities: Voice-Enabled District Assistant and AI-Powered Instructional Feedback.
keyDifferentiators: Voice-First Interface: Hands-free operation for busy educators
District-Specific Contextualization: RAG-powered knowledge base with district documents
FERPA Compliance: Self-hosted architecture ensuring data privacy
Sub-2-Second Response Times: Critical for voice interface adoption

coreTechnologyStack.frontend: React + TypeScript + Vite + Tailwind CSS (deployed on Vercel)
coreTechnologyStack.backend: Convex (real-time database and serverless functions, deployed on Convex Cloud)
coreTechnologyStack.designSystem: ShadCN + React Bits + TweakCN (voice interface components)

dataFlow: Ingestion: Firecrawl scrapes district documents → Clean, structured data
Storage: Convex RAG builds searchable knowledge base with vector embeddings
Voice Interaction: Voice input → Vapi → OpenAI → Contextual response (<2s target)
Feedback: Lesson plan → OpenAI analysis → Structured feedback with engagement suggestions
Audit: All interactions logged for FERPA compliance

performanceRequirements.apiResponse: <500ms for standard queries, <2s for RAG operations

landingPageStrategy.description: Critical conversion tool following proven, data-based approach
landingPageStrategy.defineAvatar: Use detailed educator personas to ensure all copy speaks directly to their pains, goals, and emotions about information overload and time management
landingPageStrategy.focusOnBenefits: Headline and body copy must be benefit-driven and story-driven, not feature lists. Example: 'Get instant answers to district questions while you're teaching' instead of 'Voice Interface'
landingPageStrategy.proofAndTrustSignals: Include teacher testimonials, FERPA compliance badges, and specific time-saving claims
landingPageStrategy.visualPolish: Premium feel to act as subconscious authority signal for educators and district administrators
landingPageStrategy.pricingPageStrategy: Clear tiered structure with 'popular choice' positioned to encourage upgrades, showing value for both individual teachers and districts
